content:
Enable Email Drafts for Cases

Draft emails let support agents write and save messages without sending them immediately. This option makes it possible to implement approval processes for supervisors or senior agents before sending to customers.

Available in: Salesforce Classic, Lightning Experience, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions

User Permissions Needed:
Manage Cases
Customize Application

Before enabling email drafts, set up Email-to-Case. In Salesforce Classic, enable Case Feed as well.

From Setup, select Support Settings, click Edit, and Enable Email Drafts.

Note: Changes to fields other than To, From, CC, BCC, and Subject in the Email action aren't saved when a message is saved as a draft.

If you enable email drafts, the popout-to-docked view button is disabled. Keep in mind these considerations:

Email drafts are supported only from a case's Send Email quick action.
Email approval limitations don't apply to sending emails from the email composer or other objects.
The delete icon, refresh button, and popout icon are removed from the email composer if Email Drafts is enabled for Case.

Set Up Cases for Salesforce Classic
Create Approval Processes for Email Drafts
title: Enabling Email Drafts in Service Cloud
